page.title: 18ECOLOGY - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: {FLORA}- 1. Wild Flowers.The natural Devon lanes of which there are many in the area provide a wonderful habitat for numerous species.A recent survey of one such lane revealed 55 different species. 2.Trees.There are many different types in the area. Due to the incidence of Dutch Elm Disease many elms are now dead.Probably the most predominant tree is the oak. {FAUNA}- 1.Birds.The varied habitat encourages a great many varieties - crows,rooks, magpies,jays,jackdaws,buzzards,hawks, yellow hammers,finches,fieldfares, redwings,skylarks,tits,swallows to name but a few. 2.Animals.Foxes,badgers,grey squirrels moles,voles,shrews,rats,fieldmice, lizards,sloworms,grasssnakes,adders.
